author: AFP
title: NATO airbase in Germany raises security level over 'potential threat'
text:
A
"We raised the security level at
The announcement comes just over a week after a German military base was sealed off for several hours as authorities investigated suspected
The base in Cologne-Wahn was locked down after a hole was discovered in a fence near drinking water storage facilities.
But test results eventually showed that the tap water was not contaminated, according to the German army.
At the same time, NATO announced an attempted trespassing incident at the Geilenkirchen base.
An individual attempted to enter the base but was stopped and sent away, a spokesman said.
No link between the two incidents has been established.
Germany -- a key ally of Kyiv -- has been on high alert for sabotage and attacks on military facilities in the country in the wake of Moscow's 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
In April, investigators arrested two German-Russian men on

[NATO airbase](/topic/nato-airbase)in western [Germany](/topic/germany)said Thursday it had raised its [security level](/topic/security-level)over a " [potential threat](/topic/potential-threat)".
"We raised the security level at
[NATO](/topic/nato)Airbase [Geilenkirchen](/topic/geilenkirchen)based on intelligence information indicating potential threat," the base said in a post on social media platform X.
The announcement comes just over a week after a German military base was sealed off for several hours as authorities investigated suspected
[sabotage](/topic/sabotage).
The base in Cologne-Wahn was locked down after a hole was discovered in a fence near drinking water storage facilities.
But test results eventually showed that the tap water was not contaminated, according to the German army.
At the same time, NATO announced an attempted trespassing incident at the Geilenkirchen base.
An individual attempted to enter the base but was stopped and sent away, a spokesman said.
No link between the two incidents has been established.
Germany -- a key ally of Kyiv -- has been on high alert for sabotage and attacks on military facilities in the country in the wake of Moscow's 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
In April, investigators arrested two German-Russian men on
[suspicion of spying](/topic/suspicion-of-spying)for Russia and planning attacks in Germany -- including on [US army facilities](/topic/us-army-facilities)-- to undermine military support for Ukraine.

author: J. A. Giménez
title: X TWITTER ALICANTE | El Consejo Regulador de la DOP Alicante abandona la red social X
text:
J. A. Giménez
15 NOV 2024 11:42 Actualizada 15 NOV 2024 11:49 Sigue el abandono de cuentas en X, la red social de Elon Musk (antes Twitter ). En las últimas horas no dejan de sucederse los borrados de perfiles ante la deriva de la plataforma.
El Consejo Regulador de la DOP Alicante ha informado de que ha cerrado su cuenta oficial en X debido "a la baja interacción que ofrecen sus algoritmos" y a "los cambios éticos y políticos de gestión de esta misma empresa", por lo que este órgano prefiere informar de sus actividades a través de otras redes.
Bluesky, Threads... así son las alternativas a Twitter / X ante la polarización tras la compra de Elon Musk
Vinos Alicante DOP en los mejores vinos de España Colección de Toneles Centenarios, Bodegas Enrique Mendoza, Masos, Murviedro, Pepe Mendoza Casa Agrícola y Bodegas Volver, son las bodegas que representarán a la DOP Alicante en el salón de los Grandes Vinos de España que la Guía Peñín organiza el próximo lunes en Madrid con motivo de la reciente publicación de su guía física 2025 en el recinto ferial de la capital.
Son 6 de las 35 bodegas que la guía ha calificado en esta edición calificando entre todos los vinos algunos como de los mejores de España y destacando la alta calidad media que ofrece la zona, donde casi todas las bodegas tienen vinos sobresalientes y una excelente relación calidad precio.
Migración de X a Bluesky: cómo registrarse en el nuevo Twitter
Además, el salón ha seleccionado este año una cata de monastrelles, como variedad emblemática y de reciente revaloración en la península que será realizada lunes por la tarde por Luis Vida , un reconocido formador en vinos. La DOP Alicante tiene algunas de las mejores puntuaciones por este varietal en varias guías y publicaciones del mundo.
Mejor vino blanco de España También estos días se ha conocido la noticia de que el vino “ Diapiro 2023 ” de Bodegas Pinoso , ha sido elegido “mejor vino blanco de España” en nuevo concurso internacional organizado por la revista alemana Meininger. Se trata de una meseguera, también una variedad principal y tradicional blanca de Alicante que también ha sido denostada en los con la que se están realizando vinos de gran interés en los últimos años.
TEMAS

title: Ground News - Pope addresses young Catholics in Ljubljana: “Dare to build a different world”
text:
Summary by nova24tv.si At the start of the 46th International Meeting, this time hosted by Ljubljana, Pope Francis sent a greeting to young people encouraging them to be willing to listen and to welcome those who are on the margins of society. Young people from 48 countries gathered in Cones, where they began the meeting with prayer. The meeting of young people will take place from December 28 to January 1 and will focus on the theme “Traveling together”. Read also: P… Share menu More

author: Via Bridge Michigan
title: Michigan’s backyard bird enthusiasts can join global count this weekend | City Pulse
text: A backyard view of a pileated woodpecker, a black-capped chickadee or even a winter wren this weekend could be part of a worldwide bird count. [The Great Backyard Bird Count](https://www.birdcount.org/) returns for the 27th year, beginning Feb.16 through Feb.19. The global event gives people the opportunity to observe birds and submit their findings to a database. “A lot of people just don't realize how interesting and neat birds are,” said Becca Rodomsky-Bish, project leader for the great backyard bird count. “They don't realize sometimes the diversity of birds that may be around them and so this is an opportunity to sort of have that spark moment where you realize, ‘Wow, that there are birds and their species that I never even knew existed out there.’” People are asked to watch birds for at least 15 minutes, count and identify the type, then submit their observations to [eBird.](https://ebird.org/home) Related: Observers can use [Merlin](https://merlin.allaboutbirds.org/?utm_source=adgrant&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=merlin&utm_content=merlinbirdguide&gad_source=1&gclid=Cj0KCQiAw6yuBhDrARIsACf94RUlN2--EUv3h_f1vH2_3dSpvAHVZQLPO13sc542IeLSf_zQQY5QOT4aAnzwEALw_wcB) from The Cornell Lab of Ornithology, a tool that makes it easier to identify bird species by either sound, photo or by answering three simple questions. This type of data from around the world allows a view into bird movements, including new locations for different species, which can paint a picture of a changing environment, Rodomsky-Bish said. Researchers are using the data to answer broader questions related to climate change, for example. Rodomsky-Bish said it is very likely the data from the event will show that changing weather patterns have influenced when and where birds migrate. Rodomsky-Bish said she is looking forward to data that shows birds may be moving earlier and farther north than in previous years due to the warm weather this winter. The Department of Natural Resources encourages safe practices for attracting birds. “One of the things that we recommend is to make sure they keep their feeders clean and do it before you start to see sick birds,” said Julie Melotti of the DNR Wildlife Disease Lab. “Keep areas around bird feeders tidy and clean. If food gets scattered on the ground just pick it up,” she said. Diseases like Salmonellosis and various strains of bird influenza are easily transmitted through bird feeders, Melotti said. Highly pathogenic diseases can be spread to other birds like turkeys and chickens. “Birds are really important to protect because they provide a lot of ecosystem services and a lot of cultural services to people,” she said. “In addition to all that they give to agricultural and to natural environments, they’re also obviously something that people really enjoy looking at and being around.” No comments on this item [Please log in to comment by clicking here](/login.html?referer=%2Fstories%2Fmichigans-backyard-bird-enthusiasts-can-join-global-count-this-weekend%2C86662) [ Support City Pulse - Donate Today! ](https://lansingcitypulse.org/support-us/)

author: Staff
title: Remembering Pastor Phillip Loveday: Tragedy and Tribute in Corpus Christi
text:
The story of Pastor Phillip Loveday is both heartbreaking and significant, touching on themes of community, faith, and the stark reality of mental health struggles. As the leader of Christal Valley Church in Robstown, Texas, Loveday was known for his dedication to serving others and his unwavering commitment to his faith. However, the events leading up to his tragic demise serve as a poignant reminder of the complexities hidden behind public personas.
The Disappearance of a Beloved Pastor
On April 12, 2022, Phillip Loveday went missing under mysterious circumstances. He was last seen driving his work truck from a funeral service in Corpus Christi, Texas, back to his home.
This sudden disappearance sent ripples of concern through the community he had served so passionately. Loveday was not just any individual; he was a beacon of hope and a pillar of support for many. His absence was immediately felt, and a frantic search ensued.
The Discovery
Six days post-disappearance, the community’s worst fears were realized. Pastor Loveday’s body was discovered inside his truck on South Staples Street in Corpus Christi, marking a tragic end to the search. The cause of death was determined to be an apparent suicide, leaving his family, friends, and followers in profound grief and disbelief.
RELATED:
Texas Pastor Missing for Nearly a Week Found Dead From a Gunshot Wound
Family and Community Response
Phillip Loveday was more than just a pastor; he was a loving and devoted husband, father, and a revered figure in the community. Known for his work with youth groups and the homeless, he embodied the spirit of selfless service.
His death left a void that was felt deeply by those who knew him and even those who only knew of his good deeds. The news of his passing was met with an outpouring of love and remembrance, highlighting the impact he had on the lives he touched.
Personal Struggles Behind the Pulpit
In the wake of his death, details emerged about Loveday’s personal challenges. Reports indicated that he had been grappling with depression and anxiety for years. Additionally, he was undergoing a tumultuous separation from his wife and facing significant financial difficulties. These revelations shed light on the intense private struggles that contrasted sharply with his public persona as a strong, unwavering leader.
Mental Health: A Crucial Dialogue
Phillip Loveday’s story underscores the critical importance of mental health awareness and support. It is a stark reminder that anyone, regardless of their status or profession, can face mental health challenges. Loveday’s legacy, marred by tragedy, serves as a call to action for better mental health resources and open conversations about emotional well-being.
Suicide Prevention and Support
In response to this tragedy, it is vital to highlight the importance of suicide prevention. Resources like the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (Dial 988 or 1-800-273-TALK [8255]) offer crucial support for those struggling with suicidal thoughts. Loveday’s story emphasizes the need for accessible mental health services and the importance of reaching out for help when needed.
RELATED:
Necessary Conversations: The Church, Suicide, and Mental Health

author: adaline.
title: The Circuit de la Sarthe elected “Favorite Monument of the French”
text: [Sarthe](/tag/Sarthe)elected “Favorite Monument of the French” [](https://euro.dayfr.com/content/uploads/2024/09/19/843f3bf2aa.jpg) As a candidate from [Pays de la Loire](/tag/Pays+de+la+Loire), the 24 Hours of [Le Mans](/tag/Le+Mans) circuit won the final of [France](/tag/France) 3’s show “The French People’s Favorite Monument” against 13 other sites still in the running. The route follows the Sedan Castle. The Circuit de la [Sarthe](/tag/Sarthe) elected “Favorite Monument of the French” In all, 28 monuments were selected to compete for the coveted title of “Favorite monument of the French 2024” brought back into play by the TV show “Favorite village of the French” which aims to highlight the richness of the cultural, historical and architectural heritage of the regions of France. “It is an immense honour and a great source of pride to receive this title of Favourite Monument of the French”declares Pierre Fillon, president of the Automobile Club of the West. “The 24 Hours of Le Mans circuit is an icon of our sport and our region, which welcomed more than a million people last year.” “I would first like to sincerely thank Dominique Le Mèner, President of the Sarthe Departmental Council and the Syndicat Mixte du Circuit des 24 Heures du Mans, Christelle Morançais, President of the Pays de la Loire Regional Council, as well as Stéphane Le Foll, Mayor of Le Mans and President of Le Mans Métropole. A big thank you also to all the people who voted for the circuit as well as Stéphane Bern.” “Representing the Pays de la Loire region, the legendary 24 Hours of Le Mans circuit was voted the French people’s favorite monument for 2024, demonstrating our compatriots’ attachment to the greatest…Read more on Sport Auto

author: @KLTV7
title: Woman known for her sweet tooth celebrates her 109th birthday - KLTV
text:
Updated: 27 minutes ago
KLTVs Jamey Boyum talks with East Texas Regional Airport Director Max Tovar to get an update on coming runway repair and repairs that will soon begin on a county owned hangar.
Updated: 39 minutes ago|
Catch East Texas News at 4 every Monday through Friday.
Updated: 1 hour ago
With January 1 just days away, many will set New Year's resolutions. A popular goal among adults is "Dry January," an initiative where one avoids alcohol for the whole month. But one East Texas health expert says it may not be the best approach for everyone.
Updated: 1 hour ago
If one of your new year resolutions involves budgeting – be sure to include your subscriptions because you can easily forget them and they can easily add up. As KTRE’s Shaquiena Davis reports – experts advise evaluting how much those monthly subscriptions cost before the end of year. She spoke with Legacy Institute for Financial Education Executive Director and financial coach, Joseph Ceasar on how to do this.
Updated: 1 hour ago
Updated: 2 hours ago|
Following grisly, high-profile killings, the University of Idaho is demolishing the off-campus home where four students were stabbed in November 2022.
